title: cgraph
desc: Recently developed this web application that shows graphical data related to COVID19. UI features include saving favourite countries for easy access next time a user visits (localStorage). Also the color scheme can be customized. I built it using only functaional components with hooks. I am currently improving the state management (useReducer and useContext)

title: cmw-kw.org
desc: Recently designed and developed this website for a local not-for-profit organization using Gatsby. My clients wanted a modern-looking, super fast website that they could update easily. My solution was to use Gatsby with Contentful and Netlify - using webhooks to ensure that any changes that my clients make to the content on Contentful trigger an automated build on Netlify. I am currently in the process of moving the site to Netlify.

title: Recipe Reader
desc: This is a POC that uses ResponsiveVoiceJS and JavaScript Web Speech API to read recipes in steps following voice commands like 'next','back' and 'repeat'.

title: git Query
desc: This was my personal project at Bridge-school. It allows the user to enter their git handle and then uses the events and repos endpoints of GitHub API to retrieve their recent data and display all their recent Forked events and PRs. I deployed it on firebase.

title: Speak Easy
desc: This was my final group project at Bridge-school. This website allows conference organizers and speakers to retrieve a list of all conferences from firebase, and add more using a form. The project consisted of creating API endpoints for POST and GET in a separate backend repo, while using react-redux in the frontend. It was auto deployed from Git.

title: SSUET Alumni
desc: Launched in Septemeber 2017. I designed, conceptualized and developed this website from scratch for the Canada branch of my University's Alumni.

title: getRSVP
desc: This is a simple demo of a web based invite that collects RSVPs from the users, checking if they are in the guest-list and saving their response.

title: Me
desc: Hi, I am a front-end developer based in Kitchener. As a developer, I aspire to build apps that have value as well as an intuitive, responsive design. With my background in Computer Engineering, I am drawn to various areas of web development from modern JavaScript and functional programming to the latest UI/UX trends. After completing my web development and design certificate in 2017, I have worked on various group projects and highly value effective and organized collaborative work.

title: this..
desc: I made this portfolio in React with Styled components. This project uses SVG paths to create the animated effect in the background. It was fun migrating it from plain HTML/CSS to React / Styled Components. It is easy to add / remove and change positions of projects in the grid because of the inherent efficiency of React.
